message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.CC, cs.NI, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper deals with improving the capacity of binary discrete memoryless channels using polar transformations, which is a topic closely related to information theory.
2. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - The paper may be relevant to this sub-category as it discusses channel combining and splitting, which can be applied to network communication.
3. cs.CC (Computational Complexity) - The paper may be relevant to this sub-category as it discusses decoding with a mismatched polar decoder, which may involve computational complexity.
4. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper may be relevant to this sub-category as it discusses improving the capacity of communication channels, which is a topic closely related to networking and internet architecture.
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper may be relevant to this sub-category as it discusses channel combining and splitting, which can be applied to control systems.
